words.defineEn: make a prediction about; tell in advance
words.defineVi: đưa ra dự đoán về; nói trước

words.defineEn: living quarters consisting of a superstructure in the bow of a merchant ship where the crew is housed
words.defineVi: khu nhà ở bao gồm một cấu trúc thượng tầng ở mũi tàu buôn nơi thủy thủ đoàn ở

examples: It forecloses on the property.
In many respects, the digital divide is really leading to digital invisibility, which has foreclose on the opportunities that technology has for people to participate and engage in our society.
Farmers incomes dropped steadily and many saw banks foreclose upon their property.
So the possibility is, to use the homeowner analogy, that he gets foreclosed on?
How can you bail out a bank that just took someone’s home, foreclosed on it, and they’re going to have to pay for it?
words.defineEn: (of a bank) to take away someone's property because they haven't repaid the loan they took out in order to purchase it
words.defineVi: (của ngân hàng) lấy đi tài sản của ai đó vì họ chưa trả được khoản vay mà họ đã vay để mua nó

words.defineEn: the outer or front court of a building or of a group of buildings
words.defineVi: tòa nhà bên ngoài hoặc phía trước của một tòa nhà hoặc của một nhóm các tòa nhà

examples: But if you opt in, then you're foregoing benefits that are accruing from certain other programs.
That second person would be willing to forego 50.
That second person will only be willing to forego $50,000.
They’re also more likely to forego health insurance altogether, which, as we covered in a previous video, is NOT recommended.
The process foregoes the traditional IPO, which is often lengthy, expensive and requires the disclosure of a lot of information.
words.defineEn: be earlier in time; go back further
words.defineVi: sớm hơn trong thời gian; quay trở lại xa hơn

examples: He reached out a hand and touched her forehead.
I try to give people the benefit of the doubt and assume the best in them, as everyone's faults are not written in their forehead.
Forehead reaching toward the earth, palms up.
My last tennis match took place on Link's forehead.
He had a forehead vein.
words.defineEn: the part of the face above the eyebrows and below the hair
words.defineVi: một phần của khuôn mặt trên lông mày và dưới tóc

examples: Mary is very visibly distraught, confused, even angry, which sets her apart from past depictions showing Mary at peace, following the Catholic belief that she had the foreknowledge that Jesus would rise from the dead.
words.defineEn: knowledge of an event before it occurs
words.defineVi: kiến thức về một sự kiện trước khi nó xảy ra

examples: We all know he knocked the daylights out of your foreman, Cooney.
I'm very proud that I have a young foreman.
He was going to be a foreman, and then maybe have his own construction company someday, but after that he was like, no, I'm done.
After the war, he settled in New York and was an electrical foreman on the construction of the World Trade Center.
I had a foreman to tell me that all Black women do is get fat, have a bunch of kids and collect welfare.
words.defineEn: a person who exercises control over workers
words.defineVi: một người kiểm soát công nhân

words.defineEn: a feathered plume on a helmet
words.defineVi: một chùm lông vũ trên mũ bảo hiểm

examples: In this scene, Malcolm X takes on Sam Cooke for what he sees as pandering to white audiences.

Neither party should be defined by pandering to the outer reaches of American politics and the agents of intolerance, whether they be Louis Farrakhan or Al Sharpton on the left or Pat Robertson or Jerry Falwell on the right.
words.defineEn: arrange for sexual partners for others
words.defineVi: sắp xếp bạn tình cho người khác

words.defineEn: a type of poem or speech that praises or celebrates a particular person, group, or institution
words.defineVi: một loại bài thơ hoặc bài phát biểu ca ngợi hoặc tôn vinh một người, nhóm hoặc tổ chức cụ thể

examples: And the tropical rainforest, with its great diversity of species, high nutrient turnover, and strong feedbacks among both living and dead matter, is like a lush panoply of sounds.

ESG investing won't be some carve out of the investment panoply, but every investor in the world will be armed with these new tools and these new data sets that will help them to make more informed investment decisions.

Using makeup, costumes, and props, changing backgrounds, and a variety of experimental darkroom techniques, these images offer up a panoply of personas that subvert and challenge the gender norms of the day, and also question the premise that an identity is something stable or fixed.

Well, the way we think about it at Bank of America is, it basically boils down to environmental, social and governance considerations that are part of the panoply of considerations that we as investors consider when buying and selling securities.

Divine Command Theory, for example, argues that what’s good, and what’s not, are determined by a deity, whether that’s the God of Abraham, or a panoply of gods who come up with ethical rules by committee.
words.defineVi: một mảng đầy đủ và ấn tượng

words.defineEn: a theatrical technique in which the performer uses body and hand gestures in order to suggest an idea or tell something without using words
words.defineVi: một kỹ thuật sân khấu trong đó người biểu diễn sử dụng cử chỉ cơ thể và tay để gợi ý một ý tưởng hoặc kể điều gì đó mà không cần sử dụng lời nói

examples: The impetus is on Judge Kavanaugh.
What was the impetus?
Trade was the unlikely impetus for the invention of the world’s first writing system.
And what was the impetus for that?
What’s the impetus to do it?
words.defineEn: a force that moves something along
words.defineVi: một lực mà di chuyển một cái gì đó cùng

words.defineEn: characterized by undue haste and lack of thought or deliberation
words.defineVi: đặc trưng bởi sự vội vàng quá mức và thiếu suy nghĩ hoặc cân nhắc

examples: They’re afraid to work with each other because of the way the president’s handling things and the impetuosity of his firings.

words.defineVi: đòi hỏi độ chính xác chính xác

examples: I believe that's true today in the sort of Trump era version of Russiagate, but it certainly was true as well in the early years of Putin coming to power and that those conversations were often about Washington exigencies as much as they were about Russian realities.
words.defineVi: một tình huống cấp bách hoặc khẩn cấp
